description: This table contains information about medical necessity criteria reviews. The records included in this table are Criteria Review Records (CRR) records storing items that a case manager would enter in the Utilization Review activity or during a criteria review completed in Tapestry. For example, this includes the review outcome, guideline days, and the time and date the review was completed.

columns.name: CRITERIA_REVIEW_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the criteria review record.

columns.name: CRITERIA_REV_NAME
columns.description: The name of the criteria review record.

columns.name: PATIENT_ID
columns.description: Stores the patient the criteria review is for.

columns.name: OBJECT_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The type of record the criteria review is for.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


RFL

columns.name: REFERRAL_ID
columns.description: The ID of the referral that is associated with the criteria review.

columns.name: REVIEW_ID
columns.description: The review ID associated with the criteria review.

columns.name: REVIEW_NUMBER
columns.description: The review number of the criteria review record.

columns.name: CRITERIA_SET_NAME
columns.description: The criteria set name for this criteria record.

columns.name: CRITERIA_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The status of the criteria review.


May contain organization-specific values: No

columns.description: The service date associated with this criteria review record.

columns.name: PROVIDER_ID

columns.name: PROVIDER_ID_REFERRING_PROV_NAM

columns.name: NOTE_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of any notes associated with this criteria review.

columns.description:
Review status for criteria using CERMe (third-party software from McKesson used for utilization review).

columns.name: PATIENT_CSN
columns.description: Stores the Patient Contact Serial Number for the encounter in which the review was created.

columns.name: REV_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
Stores the type of review that is performed - Admission, Concurrent, Discharge, etc. 


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.description: Stores additional comments or notes related to the review.

columns.description: Stores the instant the review was filed.

columns.name: CONTENT_SOURCE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The content provider used for this review.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries:

columns.description: Diagnosis used for the review.

columns.name: PARENT_REVIEW_ID
columns.description: Points to the parent criteria review that generated this review.

columns.name: REV_DAY_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
Stores the type of day for this review.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries:

columns.name: REVIEW_DAY
columns.description: Stores the numeric day of the review.

columns.name: GUIDELINE_DAY
columns.description: Stores the current Guideline Day for an MCG Optimal Recovery Course.

columns.name: COMP_INST_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: The time and date a utilization review was marked complete.

columns.name: COMP_USER_ID
columns.description: The user who marked a utilization review as complete.

columns.name: CLINICAL_ASSESSMENT_NOTE_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the note record for the clinical assessment note for this review.

columns.name: INITIAL_REVIEW_NOTE_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the note record for comments related to the initial reviewer's decision.

columns.name: PHYS_ADVISOR_NOTE_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the note record for comments related to the physician advisor's decision.

columns.name: REVIEW_SELECTED_YN
columns.description:
This row indicates whether a patient status associated with a review is the status selected by the user. Selection is relevant for reviews in which the user can check off criteria for more than one patient status such as observation or inpatient, but for which the user must select one target patient status to file the review. If the patient status associated with the review is the selected status, this item is set to Yes. If the patient status associated with a review is not the status selected by the user, it is set to No. If this item is empty, then the review does not have an associated patient status that is either selected or not selected.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes

columns.name: CREATION_REVIEWER_USER_ID
columns.description: The reviewer who first created this review.

columns.name: CREATION_INST_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: The instant at which this review was created.

columns.name: OVERALL_DETERMINATION
columns.description: Textual representation of the overall determination of a review.

columns.name: REVIEW_VENDOR_C_NAME
columns.description:
This item stores which criteria review vendor created the review.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: AUTH_REQUEST_STATUS
columns.description: Authorization request status from a third party criteria review vendor.
